item.title: Report X-2025041011
item.description:
Report X-2025041011

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-08
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE THAT WAS LEAKING. THE PACKAGE WAS BEING UNLOADED FROM A FEEDER ONTO THE IRREGULAR CONVEYOR BELT WHEN THE LEAK WAS DISCOVERED. THE PACKAGE WAS MARKED AND LABELED AS ID8000 CONSUMER COMMODITY WITH AN APPROPRIATE SHIPPING PAPER, LTD QTY MARK, AND CLASS NINE DIAMOND LABEL. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS THERE ARE THREE X 500ML GLASS BOTTLES SET IN INDIVIDUALLY WHITE CARTONS SET INSIDE A LARGE ZIPLOC-TYPE POLY BAG. THERE ARE TEN X 100ML BOTTLES IN ANOTHER LARGE ZIPLOC-TYPE POLY BAG THAT DID NOT LEAK. THERE WAS WADDED CRAFT PAPER ABOVE AND BELOW THE BAGGED CARTONS. ALL INNER CARTONS AND POLY BAGS HAD BECOME SOILED BY THE COLOGNE AFTER ONE OF THE 500ML BOTTLES HAD SHATTERED. THE OUTER BOX APPEARED TO BE NEW OR LIKE-NEW 12 X 12 X 12 WITH A 44 ECT ON THE BOTTOM BOX SEAL.

item.title: Report X-2025040845
item.description:
Report X-2025040845

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-12T03:42:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-13
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dunnage was around a pallet that arrived to 075 and it was discovered that a piece of the dunnage had 3 nails which punctured the side of a box containing jugs of corrosive causing a slow leak to one of the jugs. The operations supervisor advised most of the spill was contained to the box but the bottom of the box is wet and there is a small amount on the dock floor just outside the door of the trailer. Safety advised CURA would be contacted for remediation.

item.title: Report E-2025040332
item.description:
Report E-2025040332

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-12T03:42:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-19
  • City: HARLINGEN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1227ET, XPO-LHG notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 1 cup of slow reducer r7k722520 released from a metal pail due to a manufacturing defect (the product was leaking from seals). The release impacted just the pails itself. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site.
